page.title: 15I.B.A STATION _ APPEARANCE
page.content: Outside the St Hilary building there is a large pool of water which is used in case of fire.The mast and building took about one year to build. It originally conveyed V.H.S.waves as the mast is strategically positioned to give the best coverage of the area. The mast is 750 feet tall,and weighs 120 tonnes.It sits on a 2.5 ball bearing,and is held in place by staywires and cables. It is repaired whenever it fails,and is also visited by specialists every month. Various aerials and dishes hang from the mast,but not all of them belong to the I.B.A.Some belong to other users such as the Electricity Board and the Water Board,who use the mast for radio transmission purposes.
